name: Atomic UX Research Canvas [Updated]
description:
Atomic UX Research is an approach to better managing research knowledge inside and across teams. How? By organizing and documenting research findings in a way that is more efficient, transparent, and straightforward for everyone. 


It consists of breaking UX knowledge down into its constituent parts (experiments, fats, insights, and opportunities) to make its organization, management, and application simpler for anyone involved at any point in the product/service roadmap.


Why use this approach? 


  • Record and categorize research data in a timely and orderly way.
  • Centralize all your research findings in a single space instead of dozens of different reports and documents.
  • Easily trace conclusions/insights back to the raw facts from which they come.
  • Triangulate research findings from multiple research sources/experiments.
  • Build a scalable body of granular research insights.
  • Get rid of knowledge silos within research, design and innovation teams.
  • Provide easy access to all the body of research to anyone in the team who needs to consult it.
  • Support an evidence-based approach to design and innovation
